parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math - Geometry </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Finds named selections in object which are in specified LOD, intersected by given section of a line. Return value is in the form of [selection, distance]. Multiple returned arrays are nested within a single array. No intersection returns []. ''lodName'' could be one of the following: 
* "FIRE"
* "VIEW"
* "GEOM"
* "IFIRE" - ("I" stands for Indirect, almost the same as FIRE)
* "PHYSX" - PhysX geometry LOD (since Arma 3 v2.01.146666)</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [object, lodName] '''intersect''' [begPos, endPos] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [object, lodName]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> lodName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> [begPos, endPos] : [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> begPos: [[Array]] - format [[PositionAGL]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> endPos: [[Array]] - format [[PositionAGL]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER6</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - array of intersections in format: [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[selection, distance],...], where
* selection - name of intersected selection
* distance - distance from begPos
The results are also sorted, closest selection first </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[_tank, "VIEW"] [[intersect]] [[1500, 1500, 2], [1550, 1500, 2]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>sphere = "Sign_Sphere10cm_F" [[createVehicle]] [0,0,0];
[[onEachFrame]] {
	_begPos = [[positionCameraToWorld]] [0,0,0];
	_begPosASL = [[AGLToASL]] _begPos;
	_endPos = [[positionCameraToWorld]] [0,0,1000];
	_endPosASL = [[AGLToASL]] _endPos;
	_ins = [[lineIntersectsSurfaces]] [_begPosASL, _endPosASL, [[player]], [[objNull]], [[true]], 1, "FIRE", "NONE"];
	[[if]] (_ins [[isEqualTo]] []) [[exitWith]] {sphere [[setPosASL]] [0,0,0]};
	_ins [[select]] 0 [[params]] ["_pos", "_norm", "_obj", "_parent"];
	[[if]] !([[getModelInfo]] _parent [[select]] 2) [[exitWith]] {sphere [[setPosASL]] [0,0,0]};
	_ins2 = [_parent, "FIRE"] [[intersect]] [_begPos, _endPos];
	[[if]] (_ins2 [[isEqualTo]] []) [[exitWith]] {sphere [[setPosASL]] [0,0,0]};
	_ins2 [[select]] 0 [[params]] ["_name", "_dist"];
	_posASL = _begPosASL [[vectorAdd]] ((_begPosASL [[vectorFromTo]] _endPosASL) [[vectorMultiply]] _dist);
	[[drawIcon3D]] ["", [1,1,1,1], [[ASLToAGL]] _posASL, 0, 0, 0, _name, 1, 0.03, "PuristaMedium"];
	sphere [[setPosASL]] _posASL;
};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>	
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[lineIntersectsSurfaces]], [[terrainIntersect]], [[terrainIntersectASL]], [[terrainIntersectAtASL]], [[lineIntersects]], [[lineIntersectsWith]], [[lineIntersectsObjs]], [[cursorObject]], [[cursorTarget]], [[checkVisibility]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Jul 25, 2007 - 08:37
<dt class="note">[[User:ManDay|ManDay]]<dd class="note">
The most common [[LOD]] is "''FIRE''", which identifies the most detailled hitbox used for ammunition.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on Mar 27, 2014 - 14:52
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]<dd class="note">
Example (In ArmA3 ver 1.14) display returned arrays on cursor entities:<br>
<code>
Sto = [];
Fn = {
  {
    Sto set [_foreachindex,[cursortarget,_x] intersect [(asltoagl (eyepos player)),(screentoworld [0.5,0.5])]];
  } foreach ["FIRE","VIEW","GEOM","IFIRE"];
  hintsilent format ["FIRE: %1, VIEW: %2, GEOM: %3, IFIRE: %4",Sto select 0,Sto select 1,Sto select 2,Sto select 3];
};
["sample_id","onEachFrame","Fn"] call BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler;
</code>
Return FIRE: [something], VIEW: [something], GEOM: [something], IFIRE: [something].
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 20, 2015 - 18:34 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
[[intersect]] will spam .rpt if passed to it object has no skeleton. Use [[getModelInfo]] to filter out those objects.
</dd>
</dl>
